text: The first of Nagash's great and powerful edifices. Even millennia later it is still surrounded by fell magic.
The Pyramid seems to hum in the silent excitement of a pet crocodile.
Positively cracking with energy, and a threat visible from afar.
New and old chambers restored to their power, unconcealed dark magic flooding the stone and surroundings.
Manic laughter is felt rather than just heard in the entire region, as the Black Pyramid achieves lift off.
Dangerous spirits are bound within these chambers, and armed with foul intents.
Dangerous spirits are bound within these chambers, and armed with foul intents.
Dangerous spirits are bound within these chambers, and armed with foul intents.
Stalkers and guardians of desert and fortress. There is very little difference of stance, and a communality of deadly purposes.
Stalkers and guardians of desert and fortress. There is very little difference of stance, and a communality of deadly purposes.

Stables remind of hay, snorting muzzles, and swift noble creatures. These are not like that.

Dark magic and skeletal hands twist bones into machines of death.
Dark magic and skeletal hands twist bones into machines of death.
Dark magic and skeletal hands twist bones into machines of death.
A new addition to the Black Pyramid complex, a humming obelisk of dark stone to put most towers to shame.
A new addition to the Black Pyramid complex, a humming obelisk of dark stone to put most towers to shame.
A new addition to the Black Pyramid complex, a humming obelisk of dark stone to put most towers to shame.
A new addition to the Black Pyramid complex, a humming obelisk of dark stone to put most towers to shame.
Magical wards as ancient as Nagash himself, bolstering any undead fighting around the Black Pyramid.
Even the air around the Pyramid feels like knife stabs. Might be the skeleton hordes, though.
Tight, rampant tunnels within the oppressive weight of dark stone. Careful not to slip on the many skulls.
Tight, rampant tunnels within the oppressive weight of dark stone. Careful not to slip on the many skulls.
Multitudes of corrupted scarabs swarm over materials, crafting what the Great Necromancer needs.
Multitudes of corrupted scarabs swarm over materials, crafting what the Great Necromancer needs.
There are many places in the world that have been tainted by dark magic and whole battlefields that bear the scars of fell sorcery.
Raised from mass graves and despoiled tombs, the dead gather amidst the tumbled ruins and blasted groves of this ill-favoured realm.
It was made by those who are Dead, and the Dead keep it.

Raised from mass graves and despoiled tombs, the dead gather amidst the tumbled ruins and blasted groves of this ill-favoured realm.
It was made by those who are Dead, and the Dead keep it.
Undead legions vast beyond human comprehension, utterly relentless and without mercy.
The age of the living is finally drawing to an end...

Undead legions vast beyond human comprehension, utterly relentless and without mercy.
The age of the living is finally drawing to an end...
The disparate forces of the dead are united in purpose, answering Nagash's summons and fighting together under his rule.
Mummified Tomb Kings ride into battle alongside bloodthirsty Vampire Lords, while skeletal legions of a bygone age form ranks beside corpses freshly risen from their graves.

Mummified Tomb Kings ride into battle alongside bloodthirsty Vampire Lords, while skeletal legions of a bygone age form ranks beside corpses freshly risen from their graves.
Bloodthirsty beasts that fluttered like a dark cloud. Gnashing teeth and tearing claws, both ready to sink their claws and fangs into any foe.
Beneath the shifting sands lay beasts not living or dead, tread with caution.
Massive, reanimated sentinels created by the ancient Nehekharans to delineate the borders of a king's realm.
Many a rider has lost their steed in the treacherous drifting sands. The corpses still litter the fast-holding mires.
The gleaming carriages of the Nehekharan chariots shine with the power of the brassworker's mastery.
Next to every great temple of the Mortuary Cult lies a covered pit in which its deadly, ophic guardians dwell.
The crack of cartilage, the snap, the whine, and the howls of delight define the Bonemaster's work.
What better ammunition for catapults than the flaming, screaming skulls of the defeated dead?
Ushabti are large, guardian statues carved into the likeness of the gods and goddess of ancient Nehekhara.
It is not the sting of the Scorpion that kills, but rather its powerful claws and voracious, insatiable appetite.
The abominable Necrosphinx towers above the Nehekharans, offering protection and destruction in exchange for hushed and cowed adoration.
Each necropolis, has a temple dedicated to Nehekhara's Mortuary Cult. Here reside the Liche Priests served by many lesser priests.
The wording of each and every incantation is recorded on dusty papyrus scrolls written in the mysterious hieroglyphs of Nehekhara's ancient language.
The crypts of this world are dangerous places, the dead do not rest here, they do not rest.
To summon vile minions, a circle must be etched in the ground, with symbols of a dead language scrawled around it.
An infernal lodestone is planted inside a binding circle, summoning the most powerful of all spirits as it glows.
A swirling mass of dark energy swarms around the site, tearing a gateway in the sky to the Realm of Souls.
DISABLED
From these death houses, the dead continue to rise to fulfil their as-yet unfinished duty.
Once tombs of those with noble blood, they have been awakened to pursue their living aspirations once more.
Vast chambers of worked and preserved bone provide the perfect sanctuary for the resting dead.
Bones, a load of them, useful for all kinds of things.
Necromancy has the privilege of not needing supplies for it's undead armies, but it can't hurt, can it?

The Tomb Kings demanded loyalty from their soldiers until death and beyond. In Unlife, they expect the same, and so does Nagash.
